valencia.for91days.com/2015/03/valencian.title: Valencian Pilota For 91 Days in Valencia Travel Blog...
valencia.for91days.com/2015/03/valencian.snippet: The unofficial sport of Valencia is pilota, which is a type of handball played in long halls known as trinquets. This fast-moving game is like a mix between volleyball and tennis, but looks a lot more painful than either of those.

balls.com/2014/09/valencian-pilota-about.title: Valencian Pilota About the Balls...
balls.com/2014/09/valencian-pilota-about.snippet: Valencian pilota is a traditional handball sport played in the Valencian Community. Its origins are not known, but seem to be related to the French Jeu de paume. The ball is struck with a bare, or almost bare, hands.

mminvalencia.blogspot.com/2013/11/in-val.title: In Valencia as an outsider: Valencian pilota...
mminvalencia.blogspot.com/2013/11/in-val.snippet: Pilota is a Valencian sport of historical significance which is currently mostly watched by old men betting a minimum of 50 Euros on the game (the game we went to see in the Triquet de Pelayo near the old train station in...

daniferrando.blogspot.com/2010/03/la-pil.title: LA PILOTA VALENCIANA: Valencian pilota...
daniferrando.blogspot.com/2010/03/la-pil.snippet: Valencian pilota. Ratchet is played in or on the street and takes its name from the fact that the ballplayer may scrape the ground with his hand to return the ball, and includes two specific strokes, "raspar" (hitting the ball at...

unprofessionaltranslation.blogspot.com/2.title: Unprofessional Translation: A Pilotari Interpreter...
unprofessionaltranslation.blogspot.com/2.snippet: One of the things I did during the Christmas break was go and watch a pilota match. Pilota is a traditional Valencian handball game with a documented history going back to medieval times. The players are called pilotaris.

holavalencia.net/2009/02/pilota-in-the-t.title: Pilota in the Trinquete de Pelayo Hola Valencia Blog...
holavalencia.net/2009/02/pilota-in-the-t.snippet: Pilota is one of the most important sports in the Valencian Community. A fast-paced team game which combines elements of tennis, racquetball, and handball, Pilota has been played in the region for centuries. And despite...
